newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Asia Gas Oil/Jet - Diesel mixed as slide persists.
newsitem.headline: Asia Gas Oil/Jet - Diesel mixed as slide persists.

text.p: After collapsing for more than two weeks, gas oil prices took a brief breather earlier in the day before continuing its slide, traders said on Wednesday.
Traders said they hope that recent cuts in runs at three refineries in Singapore would soon help to ease the gas oil glut and boost prices in forward months.

Singapore gas oil premiums also took a beating falling to parity to Singapore spot quotes, from 20 cents previously. There was even talk that a cargo might have been bought by a Malaysian firm recently at a discount to Singapore quotes for a 20,000-tonne cargo, free-on-board (fob) basis.
Traders said there were buying interest at 50 cents discount to spot Singapore quotes.

Unlike Singapore, the MidEast market still looked steady with premiums for 1.0-percent sulphur gas oil at a 55-cent per barrel to MidEast quotes fob, while prompt cargoes were seen as high as 80-cent premium.
Trader said the healthy MidEast market was due to sellers coverind their sales into India for February from that region, which could not be done with cargoes from the Mediterranean.
Traders said Indonesia recently bought a gas oil cargo from a US major at a 20-cent-per barrel premium, on a cost-and-freight basis for February delivery.

Gas oil swaps rebounded by as much as 40 cents from Tuesday on profit-taking and a technical correction. February was quoted at $25.40/$25.60 and March at $25.70/$25.90. Some traders said the rebound could partially be due to optimistic forecast on the volume of gas oil that India would take for March.
But physical gas oil defied the recovery seen on swaps with two traders offering at $24.80 for mid-February lifting cargoes fob, down from $25.50-$25.80 on Tuesday.

But traders said buyers remained aloof as they were waiting for the contango to widen to at least 60 cents from the current 30-40 cents in order for them to buy and cover the cost of putting the cargoes into storage.

Traders see jet fuel price at more than $2.00 a barrel above gas oil with premiums at 30 cents. They said the $1.90 per barrel premium, cost-and-freight, which a major sold to China recently signalled a steady jet fuel market.
With Japan and South Korea out of the market, China appeared to be the best outlet for jet fuel, traders said.
(Prices in dollars per barrel)
MTH FOB SIN BUY/SELL PREV BUY/SELL
FEB JET KEROSENE/KERO 27.30/27.80 29.50/30.00
FEB JET/GAS OIL SWAPS 2.00/2.30 1.50/1.80
-- Singapore Newsroom (+65-870 3084)
